name: Bryant Park Grill
address: 25 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

reviews.text:
This was my first time dining at Bryant Park Grill, and it was absolutely amazing! From start to finish, the experience exceeded expectations.

Our server Lena was a darling:  attentive, warm, and made sure everything was perfect. We started with the jumbo lump crab cake and salad, which was fresh and flavorful. My partner had the cashew-crusted salmon (he swapped the potatoes for asparagus,  great choice!), and I had the pan-roasted branzino, cooked to perfection. The blackberry nojito seltzer was a hit! We ended the evening with a chocolate brownie and vanilla ice cream that was the perfect sweet touch.

Despite the buzz of the city around us, the atmosphere felt calm and intimate.   A little oasis right in the heart of it all. I guess when you have an amazing date and great food, nothing else really matters ğŸ˜Š

Highly recommend and canâ€™t wait to return!

Insgesamt war unser Besuch okay. Das Lokal liegt sehr schÃ¶n am Bryantpark, wobei man an warmen Tagen vor allem wunderbar drauÃŸen sitzen kann. Im Innenbereich ist das Lokal vielleicht etwas altmodisch, wenngleich stilvoll, und der Service ist sehr freundlich. Das Essen ist gut und preislich in Ordnung, aber jetzt auch kein kulinarisches Erlebnis.

I wouldnâ€™t like to give low rating reviews to restaurants because I feel most of the time the owners and staffs were trying hard to offer the best food/services to their guests. But this encounter gave an eerie feeling that this restaurant and staffs are sending out a message that Asian are not welcome here. My wife and I walked in around 12:45 pm without reservation and judging from the empty tables there are plenty of choices for a window or center tables. But instead, we were seated to a tiny corner table isolated from the rest of customers. Next to us only one table was taken  by also two Asian males. Rest of the customers were mostly white and far away from us. Itâ€™s so obvious that reminded me the apartheid policies. The Cobb salad with Salmon we ordered came with a piece of lime on a stick but itâ€™s already squeezed (not on my salad since I didnâ€™t taste the lime flavor and I donâ€™t think they should and usually wonâ€™t squeeze it for you). I canâ€™t believe this kind of insulting behavior. I raised my observation to the manager and , of course, he denied anything intentional. But just as we talked, the hostess just sit another Asian lady next to our table far away from others. In contrast to next doorâ€™s  NYC grand libraryâ€™s wonderful display emphasizing minority heritage that one would expect big apple is a melting pot of races and cultures, this type of discrimination is really shocking and unacceptable.
Honestly eat anywhere else. Food is horrible! Worst ever. Itâ€™s unfortunate itâ€™s the only â€œrestaurantâ€ within Bryant park.

Bryant Park Grill never disappoints! The chicken sandwich was absolutely amazing â€” perfectly cooked and full of flavor â€” and the salad was just as delicious and fresh. Beautiful setting, great service, and outstanding food. Highly recommend!

Great restaurant!
We were exploring NYC and tyring to find a place to eat a late lunch and fell upon this place when looking for another restaurant.
Was a beautiful day and we sat outside. Very pleasant area.Eventhough there was construction going on in Bryant Park we barely noticed.
The service was nothing outstanding or notable, but acceptable and the waiters were friendly and competent.
The food was well above average. We shared the Ginger Shrimp then had Fettuccine, Lemon Chicken and Ravioli. All excellent and can be recommended.
The wine was average / slightly above; however, I have to say that I find it difficult to find an average daily restaurant with a good wine menu.
Overall, I warmly recommend Bryant Park Grill.
Cena ore 20.30, il locale Ã¨ rumoroso paragonabile a pizzeria del sabato sera in Italia. Dall'esterno sembra promettere altro. Il cibo discreto per quello che si spende.

I came here with my friends as a visit not only to see my Father (Rahman) but also to have a little gathering. Meeting the managers Tom & Donna was heart warming. Elizabeth our waitress provided such good service, Iâ€™d definitely come here again!!
Great location, food is mediocre. Go for a drink at the bar and an appetizer for the experience.

My secret haven. Usually crowded; got lucky today!
Fantastic pancakes! Excellent gazpacho! Chicken Cobb Salad was huge. French Toast supreme!

The location and the terrace is nice. Went for lunch on a tues with my boss, and got Salmon with mashed potatoes. Everything was luke warm and the sauce was not melted because the food was so cold. I couldnt even finish it. Added: Im adding this because it happend a little later but i got terribly ill vomiting for 1 full day and since this is the only place i ate at i feel it came from the food. I think management should take a good hard look at kithen cleanliness and health standards.

Bryant Park Grill is a perfect place for a team gathering especially on a special day like birthday. Our team reserved a lunch of 6. Setting is very nice on a sunny Autumn day and couldnâ€™t be better until foods were served. I ordered $47 steak frites with â€œMediumâ€. Steak was very well done but I didnâ€™t want to send the food back as I didnâ€™t want to ruin the atmosphere. But I thought I would give some feedback and the waiter said â€œIt looks medium to me. What do you want me to do?â€ the comment was unbelievable . He made our team lunch horrible and we left without birthday cake as a dessert this place is not for tourists only. There are many offices and we want to celebrate our special day at this beautiful restaurant. They really need to do a better job
The food at the BPG is always perfectly prepared,  and served by very friendly and attentive staff. We dine here every week.

A spacious and very pleasant restaurant, in a quiet location opposite Bryant Park, with a magnificent terrace for sunny days. The food is easily among the best in New York, and the service is very friendly, warm, and attentive (thanks to RenÃ©!).
I highly recommend it! A very good place to eat.

I took the opportunity to continue reading my feel-good thriller Honesty Bar, which I found on Amazon (in English and French)â€”a plot for the whole family set in Paris, Warsaw, and the Seychelles!ğŸ’•

What a nice place for a meal.
Food was amazing and service was top notch.

We were excited to come here: a restaurant in the park?! And the vibes were so good and cute!

Then we were seated and sat there for 10 minutes at 4pm with two tables finishing up in her section. Another family sat and was greeted by their server in 5 minutes. At 4:15, I walked up to the host and our server finally came over (black curly hair, long nails) and was like mad?? About it?? At 4:20, we ended up not having time because we were going to drunk Dracula at 5pm. So we ordered, then decided not to wait and left.

I've been a bartender and server at restaurants since I was 16. Girl, how are you gonna make money with that kinda attitude? It should be so easy for you! It's the middle of NYC and everything is expensive. I get it's a weird time and likely shift change or end of shift, but that isn't MY fault.
Un excellent restaurant dans un magnifique park le service est top la salle intÃ©rieur ou la terrasse sont trÃ¨s bien pour des mets trÃ¨s fins c'est une brasserie++
We had a lovely meal below the sycamores here. Excellent service from Vicente.

Truly disappointing. I specifically came to this restaurant because I wanted to try their food â€” I had read many positive reviews and was looking forward to a pleasant evening. I simply wanted to enjoy a glass of champagne and sit at an outdoor table. Usually, when I visit restaurants, I also order food, but this time I was refused seating twice.

When I came back the second time, the hostess not only refused again but even suggested that I visit two neighboring restaurants instead. I believe management should know that a guest who intentionally comes to their restaurant is being directed elsewhere.

I sat across from the entrance for about an hour and a half, right in front of the hostess, mentioning that Iâ€™d love to have champagne once a table was available. The restaurant was almost empty, with only a few tables occupied, yet no one offered me a seat.

I often visit beautiful places and love writing positive reviews about great service and atmosphere. Unfortunately, this restaurant showed clear discrimination and a lack of respect toward guests.
Restaurants should value their customers and not judge them by appearance, and should never refuse a table just because someone wants to start with a glass of champagne.
Very disappointed â€” especially because I genuinely wanted to enjoy their cuisine and atmosphere.

Nice park where you can stroll in good company in New York city.
There is a number of restaurants around it, and this restaurant is nice one with good enough food at a reasonable price for NYC.

It makes me think about the grand bistros you can find in Paris.

Great place to catch a game on TV!
Retractable roofs give you an outdoor feel. The inside dining is very nice as well.
Wonderful evening last night.  The 5 of us had dinner and wine on the patio outside and the food was exceptional.  I had the steak frites.  The service was good and I can highly recommend this place.
Cibo ottimo e ambiente tranquillo
Loved the food and drinks were amazing. Some great service there.

This place is a crappy tourist trap. What a waste of good space! Food is expensive and blend. The roof is even worse, might have good views but the view becomes invisible when you realize that you paid $20 for a small cup of the worst drink of your life.

Byrant Park Grill in NYC is a perfect spot for lunch. The food was tasty, the service was super lovely, and the whole place just felt easy and welcoming. Perfect spot to kick back, eat well, and enjoy the views.
Had outside seating overlooking the Bryant Park- very nice

Even after dining at Michelin 3-star restaurants around the world, I have never experienced service this rude and humiliating. As a food content creator, I originally came here to take beautiful photos and promote this place positively, but what happened completely changed my mind.

One Chinese bald server had an extremely rude attitude. We repeatedly asked for the check, but he never came. Instead, he kept serving other large tables and chatting with other guests, deliberately ignoring us. Finally, he shouted at us, saying that we â€œmust wait 20 minutes to pay because thatâ€™s the rule here,â€ and then added in Chinese, â€œThis is not the kind of place you think it is.â€ The aggressive tone and words were filled with discrimination and arrogance. We could understand if the rule was that only he could handle the bill, but the way he yelled at us was simply unacceptable.

Even after we signed the tip as usual, he still forced us to open the bill in front of him to check whether we had signed the tip, which was humiliating and discriminatory. Other staff members were polite, but this one serverâ€™s behavior completely ruined the experience.

This is my very first time ever leaving a negative review on Google. Instead of recommending this restaurant, I now feel obligated to warn everyone: avoid this place at all costs. I will never come back.

DecidÃ­ festejar mi cumpleaÃ±os en este restaurante en familia y fue inolvidable. Cenas en el centro de la ciudad, un lugar mÃ¡gico. La atenciÃ³n super bien, el mozo super simpÃ¡tico.

Me trajeron un brownie con helado para cantarme el feliz cumpleaÃ±os.

Sensed some hostility and tension amongst the staff which is never a nice look. I enjoy the food here but my server was extremely short we could barely get him to take a moment and talk to us at a normal pace. Probably busy but still, he could probably earn better tips if he slowed down. Additionally I asked if the fries were gluten free. I *think* he said there is cross contamination because they fry it in the same fryer as the calamari. Not feel so great now so I am wondering if he meant they are fried in the same batterâ€¦ jury is still out but that is a pretty big difference!
Worst service
Meat had small bone inside

The food was very tasty, with portions big enough to fill you up even with just a salad. The atmosphere in the park was incredible â€” a little island of peace and quiet in the middle of a busy city. The service was excellent as well, with friendly and welcoming staff. I highly recommend this place.
Dinner on veranda.   Food was wonderful,   excellent service and surprisingly reasonably priced for location.

Um lugar super agradÃ¡vel. NÃ£o fizemos reserva. EstÃ¡vamos pelo Bryant Park e resolvemos almoÃ§ar. Sentamos na Ã¡rea do jardim. Comida super bem servida. Pedi a Ceasar de SalmÃ£o e tomei um vinho branco (copo). De sobremesa, compartilhamos uma torta de limÃ£o. O cardÃ¡pio Ã© bem variado.
Great place - dined al fresco
Verdaderamente sensacional! Muy bonito, muy sabroso y detallados los platillos, el personal maravilloso, atento, cordial y el ambiente amable, de jardÃ­n fresco y agradable.
Los tragos son horribles. Cuando pedimos que los rebajaron porque eran intocables, lo hicieron de mala gana agregÃ¡ndole un jarabe feo. Y son caros.

The atmosphere at Brian Park is absolutely incredible and having this patio and rooftop dining option with a bar adds to the beautiful experience that is Brian Park. The staff was incredibly friendly. The dinner options in the restaurant were very good. However, the rooftop seemed a little bit more like bar food. Their signature cocktails were actually pretty good. I would recommend going to the rooftop for a drink but if you want a better meal experience, definitely go downstairs to the restaurant.  Enjoy!!

To begin with, dining right next to the spacious atmosphere of the Bryant Park on its own was a very pleasant experience. I had the slow roasted half soy-honey duck. The duck was perfectly cooked and was tender on the inside. It came with fresh beans, a buttery sauce, cilantro and grapes on top mixed with the sauce. Some parts of the duck were quite fatty, so I thought it would definitely be better if it came with rice or potatoes instead of a lot of buttery sauce. However, the fresh beans were great. Their New York Cheesecake was also very delicious, and the waiter was amazing.
I had a couple of drinks with friends here. Was so nice and the bartender was amazing. Do not remember his name, but he was so nice. Thank you! Definitely coming back
Delicious, fresh food with an emphasis on seafood. Attentive service, NYC park ambiance (we sat outside). Fish and Chips platter was excellent!

Wonderful venue with both indoor and outdoor seating. We sat inside which was lovely but a little loud and wished we had opted for outdoors with a view of the park.

The menu had an excellent range of options all very farm to table sort of choices and so many that we will certainly return on our next visit. The gazpacho was excellent!!! My miso crusted cod perfect!! Very healthy food with perfectly sized portions. Also some excellent vegan options on the menu!!!
Convenient mid-town location and a big enough venue to accommodate larger parties.

Service was very slow. Sat with empty drinks and finished plates. Had to flag someone down to order another beverage, which took 15 min. to get to the table. No one ever checked in after food arrived to ask if we needed anything else if we were enjoying our food.
We skipped coffee and dessert because we didnâ€™t want to wait any longer.
Food is mediocre at best.
Disappointing experience.
Great spot right by Bryant Park! The food was fresh and tasty, the service was friendly, and the vibe is unbeatable. Perfect place to relax and enjoy a meal in the city.
Fun place, attractive place with stellar wait staff who make you feel like youâ€™re a beloved member of the restaurant. Even if itâ€™s your first visit as it was mine.

Lo unico lindo es la vista. Los tragos son imposibles de tomar.
20 dolares cada trago y ya estan pre-hechos. Le pedis que te lo bajen un poco y ni voluntad le ponen.
Todos tragos â€œde autorâ€ pero espantosos. No recomiendo como BAR. Hasta la coca era fea (de chorro, muy aguada). Solo para comer

Food is good but service could definitely improve. Our server was cold and brusque, and service itself was incredibly slow. We spent 45 minutes for our food, a burger and a crabcake. Not complex dishes or anything that would require extended preparation. And this was During a slow time. There is no reason it took so incredibly long. Be advised if you have other things to do in your day, avoid Bryant Park Grill
Besten sÃ¼sskartoffel pommes ğŸŸ!!

í¬ë¦¬ìŠ¤ë§ˆìŠ¤ ë§ˆì¼“ ì¬ë¯¸ë‚¨.

One of my favorite places to take visitors for a NY brunch. The main attraction is of course the wonderful Bryant Park location

Chill in the park before leisurely heading to Bryant Park Grill to eat ! If you want to sit inside then a reservation is necessary with a phone call and a confirmation via text day of.

The indoor seating was spacious and classy with friendly service.

The food is about what you expect. Not great but not bad either.

Iâ€™ve live my life working in New York City! I always pass by this place going to work almost every single day! Iâ€™ve dreamt of having to dine here with my family.

Until the other day, got a chance to have a dinner with my BFF - well first the surroundings is pretty much decent outside, inside dine in is just normal.  Too bad the second roof area closed.

The bar tender serve my bloody orange with strong kick  with too much rum or vodka, which is not impressing unlike the drink i got my Blossom restaurant.  So I rated the cocktail drink (2/5 for $22) is a bit too much!

Letâ€™s rate the Seafood Pasta (5/5) for the price is reasonable, it is big portion to share on of at least 3 people, so I would order that for my family.

When it comes to Lamb Chops wow!!! I would say you nailed it, who ever the Chef making it I would rate 10/10.  Lamb is my favoritesâ€¦whenever I dined in the finest restaurant, if lamb is in the menu, I always want to tryâ€¦

Additionally, the customer care is exceptional!!! very flexible to their customer.

The food was great. I have branzino with black ink risotto and for appetizer bread with vegetable spreads. I had a drink apparel Spritz and everything was delicious. For dessert I had the homemade ice cream.
The atmosphere is great but there is a loud echo and hard to talk and hear eachother.

A fabulous meal with very friendly servers. Staff were able to give us an earlier sitting at an indoor table. Lovely atmosphere at lunch time.  The food was well presented and tasted devine. Service was excellent as always. Highly recommend

Sat on the rooftop which was far more relaxed atmosphere than the first floor. The rooftop overlooks Bryant Park and a great view of the stage. Server were very accommodating to our party of 6. The frozen margarita that I order was well balanced. The wings (as pictured) was cooked just right and heavily sauced adding amazing flavor. We ordered a variety of plates after that. The Vietnamese spring roll were big and complimented well with the peanut sauce. Also tried the chicken kabob which was delicious. You do have to walk up several flights of stairs to get there however we were told there was an elevator but there is no signs as to where.

Went here with a group of 4 for lunch right as they opened at 11:30. We ate outside, the atmosphere was  lovely, the waiters were friendly and all seemed very knowledgeable about the menu. 3 full meals and 3 appetizers came out in 6 minutes. Now this was very nice and fast, but I'm not sure if its because they had just opened, or because they had the food pre-made. Either way it was all pretty good. I got the breakfast burrito off of the brunch menu. It was BIG, for NYC prices this was a nice full plate of food, a whole burrito and a salad. The burrito was really good, it had scrambled eggs and beans in it, but I found the salad to be lacking. It was just lettuce, straight out off the box topped with Pico de gallo and also some kind of vinegrette dressing. The combination of all 3 was alright but not great. Everyone else got the soup of the day  and all really liked it. This was a nice meal, pricey, of course, but pretty good food and amount of food for the total cost. To put in perspective, 3 soups and 3 entrees was $114.

Nestled in the heart of Bryant Park, this restaurant offers a perfect blend of convenience, charm, and culinary excellence. The ambiance is inviting, the service impeccable, and the food was outstanding. I had for the Cobb Salad, a beautifully presented dish with fresh, well-balanced ingredients and a generous portion size. Our server was the perfect balance between attentiveness and discretion, ensuring a seamless dining experience. As we enjoyed our meals, the picturesque view of the park added to the atmosphere. Without a doubt, this is a place we would return to.

The Burrata salad starter paired well with the shrimp. Be sure to ask for more bread as that shrimp oil is verysavory that you will want to dip more.

Steak was cooked to medium rare perfection as instructed. As for the desserts, go for the classics and not the olive oil cake. As of Jun 2025, you will fork out 50-70 for a three course meal here. Decently priced considering the central location and food quality.

I have passed by this restaurant several times and had to check it out. The location alone was worth it. Right in the corner of Bryant Park. We were seated outside in the clear tent so we could take in the view of the park. The twinkle lights added a special effect to the experience. Dinner was excellent, the salmon was cooked to my liking and served with plenty of vegetables. A nice serving size.
Soup and salad were flavorful and fresh. I especially loved the bread and butter.
Server was friends, answered our questions, and very attentive.  I love this place! A must visit.

After visiting the ice skating rink at Bryant Park ,my family and I decided to have lunch here after we stumbled upon this spot.
Thankfully they had an open spot for four!
I was very especially impressed with how fast our food came!
The food was delicious, the service was really great and the decor of the place was just gorgeous - it was beautifully decorated for the Christmas season.
Definitely a must visit.

Edit : Visited here again - the food did not disappoint!

We ordered crispy calamari and codfish and fish and chips. Calamari were little too crispy. And cod was little dry and very salty. Ambience was magic,  wonderful Bryant Park. Waiters were very kind and friendly.

Bryant Park Grill is an iconic establishment right in the heart of Manhattan overlooking Bryant Park. We were seated in the garden room that was airy and light. Challah French Toast with homemade strawberry jam and mascarpone mousse was delicious. My husband also enjoyed his banana Walnut buttermilk pancakes. The pear salad was tasty. The staff are very professional and attentive.

I loved this place. First of all the staff was incredibly friendly and the food was top notch. The fried cauliflower sits on this sauce that is to die for. The mocktail was phenomenal. Seating was plentiful. Great ambiance.

I had an amazing experience at this restaurant! Leonardo was an excellent server â€“ very attentive, kind, and professional. The food was absolutely incredible, every dish was full of flavor and beautifully presented. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for top-quality service and delicious meals. I will definitely be coming back!â¤ï¸âœ¨ğŸ¤©

Este restaurante me encanta por el dÃ³nde estÃ¡ situado, su buen ambiente y entorno, a parte de su comida.

Muy buenos tanto los pescados como las carnes y ensaladas. Suelo pedir el salmÃ³n con verduras, muy jugoso.

El servicio y todo muy bien, como siempre. Lo recomiendo, sobre todo para sentarse en las mesas de fuera, muy agradable.

I stumbled upon this restaurant by chance. The service was excellent, and the food was very delicious. New York was the final stop on my long journey living in the U.S., and I was so happy to have found this place. If I ever come back to New York, I will definitely visit this restaurant again

A real winner in midtown, whether for a corporate expense account lunch (it's pricey) or a romantic date night. Buzzy businessy bar scene, elegant large dining room with picture windows overlooking Bryant Park and a well heated tent overlooking the spring park plantings. We went in jeans and hoodies so they sat us in the tent with several other tourists, but the meal was equally good. Had grilled duck in a balsamic glaze with cherries and a creamy polenta. Skipped the crab cakes and the Moroccan lamb skewers with dips, and went straight to a quinoa platter with roast vegetables. As good as the duck! Had delicious Blackberry Mojitos too.
Very nice ambiance, inside and outside. Server was very nice and attentive. The food was amazing. We ordered the potato leek soup and the garlic/ginger shrimp and both were delicious.
I love coming here when I visit NYC! The food and customer service is always 10/10 and the vibes are great at Bryant Park. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
The resultant really was excellent with great ambience and decor, wonderful staff. I liked few dishes I ordered but overall a great experience

I strongly believe that Bryant Park Grill is worth visiting primarily for its stunning outdoor seating area. The food, in my opinion, is rather average and nothing to write home about. On the other hand, I must commend the staff for being extremely welcoming and efficient. If you plan to enjoy the outdoor seating during warmer weather, my recommendation is to arrive early for lunch. Personally, I find the food to be quite bland and definitely overpriced. However, if your goal is to savor an appetizer and a drink while taking in the views, then this is the ideal spot for you. If you're solely interested in finding food around Bryant Park, you might want to consider visiting Lâ€™Adresse American Bistro or Los Tacos 1 instead.

If it weren't for Stephanie I would've left. Her energy is everything the icing on the cake that starts from the first impression . She gave us the best seats in the house despite being brushed off by the inside hostesses for not having a reservation and made us feel welcome. It's the holiday season greetings really do set the toneğŸ˜

Beyond that our appetizers and lunch entrees were delicious. Can't wait to try the shrimp Cobb next time and those orange drinks w the flowered I saw the ladies having.

We stopped by on a whim to grab a drink and some apps before shopping the Winter Village and we loved the warmly lit, inviting ambiance inside.
Our server was minimally friendly, but it didnâ€™t dampen our experience, to be honest. Itâ€™s a beautiful place to stop and eat, and is probably even lovelier at dinner time.

Nice all-day restaurant by the Bryant Park and obviously overlooking the grounds of Bryant Park. They have different areas which you can choose from. I went here to do a business meeting over coffee and some drinks.  I find it convenient spot because it's not very crowded and staff are very attentive.
